title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 07 April 2016 - XWiki
content:
has quit 00:58  has quit 01:01  has joined #xwiki 01:03  lo sdumitriu :) 01:13  has joined #xwiki 03:43  has quit 03:45  has joined #xwiki 05:06  has quit 05:06  has joined #xwiki 05:16  has quit 05:18  has joined #xwiki 05:18  has joined #xwiki 07:00  has quit 07:03  has joined #xwiki 07:33  has quit 07:33  has joined #xwiki 07:57  has quit 08:45  has quit 08:48  has joined #xwiki 08:51  has joined #xwiki 08:53  has joined #xwiki 08:56  has joined #xwiki 08:56  has joined #xwiki 08:56  has joined #xwiki 09:09  has joined #xwiki 09:14  has joined #xwiki 09:20  has quit 09:22  has joined #xwiki 09:33  Hi everyone, I have this issue http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11843 (Watchlist App Email Notification generates incorrect links when XWiki is deployed as ROOT) on our 7.0.1 :-( 09:34  I must reopen it? 09:35  Link in mail notifications duplicates /bin path element into /bin/bin in every link 09:40  Pbas: no don't reopen since it was closed and released already but you can create a new one if you want 09:40  ok thxs 09:45  Pbas: yes better create another issue because it was probably fixed and then we introduced a regression 09:46  yes I will :) ty 09:49  has joined #xwiki 10:01  Here you are: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XCOMMONS-959 10:14  Ok I will test your workaround vmassol (not this one "Don't install XWiki as ROOT" of course ;-) )  : Use the urlrewritefilter 10:14  good morning everyone, today is BFD 10:15  cool! :-D 10:15  :) 10:16  (I understand why I must open a new issue then) :P 10:22  has joined #xwiki 10:27  Hum more seriously I think I will waiting the fix (urlrewritefilter seem to be complicate for a temporary fix and maybe remove /bin from url) 11:04  guys, anyone sees anything wrong with this XML: 11:04  p>test

11:04  ? 11:05  I must be blind but I can't see anything wrong with it and the xml sax parser says "A DOCTYPE is not allowed in content" 11:06  missing a < around the first p> 11:06  fixing but I don't think that's the reason 11:07  interesting, I know get something different 11:07  has joined #xwiki 11:08  The processing instruction target matching "[xX][mM][lL]" is not allowed. 11:11  ok forget it 11:11  found my problem 11:27  has joined #xwiki 11:36  has joined #xwiki 11:40  Hi, I just checked the database compatibility list and noticed that SQLServer is not officially supported. Has anyone tried using xwiki with SQLServer? Or is it safe to use HyperSQL in a prod environment? 11:45  fkh: we usually recommend MySQL in production. hsqldb is mostly stored in memory so not great for a big instance (we mostly use it for test) 11:45  many people seems to be using postgres too 11:49  has quit 11:55  or postgresql or oracle, any of the supported DBs basically 11:56  (at http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DatabaseSupportStrategy ) 11:56  we don't spend time maintaining SQLServer but when someone sends a patch for it we can apply it 11:57  Hello sympa users, I didn't receive my own mail to xwiki user list anymore, anyone else have this problem? 11:57  Of course "Receive your own posts to the list" is checked to Yes 11:58  Thank you guys for the answers, I'll check if MSSQL is running and if not will fall back to Oracle since those are the only two supported DBs where I work 11:59  I recommend using XWiki on Oracle since this is supported, there are people using it on MSSQL but we don't know whether they have "minor" issues which they choose to work around. 12:00  Thx, admins are pushing towards MSSQL that's the only reason I was asking about it, otherwise Oracle is fine for me ;) 12:23  mflorea: hi, could you point me to the place in the wysiwyg code where we check if the syntax can be edited in wysiwyg? 12:23  (ie if there's a parser and renderer for that syntax I imagine) 12:26  found it 12:27  WysiwygEditorScriptService.isSyntaxSupported 12:28  mflorea: btw the wysiwyg editor supports xwiki/1.0 syntax? https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/ec2c93d04c8de30e3dd0f8b32ca9d7051420a8cf/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-flamingo/xwiki-platform-flamingo-skin/xwiki-platform-flamingo-skin-resources/src/main/resources/flamingo/menus\_content.vm#L131-L131 12:30  vmassol: that's for the old TinyMCE editor, it's a leftover 12:30  yep we need to remove that 12:30  so we should remove it right? 12:31  yep 12:31  ok 12:31  doing it 12:31  keep only isSyntaxSupported 12:35  guys could you check my last comment at http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XRENDERING-443?focusedCommentId=90954&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-90954 12:35  about the html/4.01 renderer 12:43  has quit 12:45  vmassol: same kind of  comment I did an a recent mail, we moved to html 5 so I don't see much value in investing time on a html/4.01 12:46  sure but it's the same question 12:46  do we want to allow users to edit some version of html/xhtml in the wysiwyg editor 12:46  right now they can't 12:46  we don't have any valid combination of html/xhtml parser and renderer 12:47  it's a bit lame, knowing that the wysiwyg editor operates in html/xhtml :) 12:47  has joined #xwiki 12:47  we need to do a html 5 parser anyway so sure 12:48  note that the html5 renderer is probably wrong 12:48  it's probably an XHTML 1.0 renderer 12:48  cheecking 12:48  it's a customized xhtml renderer 12:49  extends XHTMLChainingRenderer 12:49  I'd need ti check the HTML5 spec 12:49  but what is important is that it's officially produceing html 5, if it's not in some place then it's a bug 12:49  to see if it says it's XHTML 12:50  it's not that it's XHTML but what Guillaume told me is that XML is valid in html 5 12:50  it's not the issue 12:50  in other word it's not strict 12:50  the issue is whether we're transfomring non XHTML into XHTML 12:50  so imagine you have some html5 input 12:50  and you edit in wysiwyg and just save with no change 12:51  it shouldn't convert your input 12:51  we have this on any syntax 12:51  nothing to do with xhml vs html 12:51  if you have 12:51  in xwiki/2.x you will end up with 12:52  we don't remember the detail in the rendering event, just the meaning 12:52  yes unfortunately (and that's a know bug) 12:52  \*known 12:52  let's say limitation :) 12:52  but yes I agree 12:52  if the generated html 5 is fully valid it's acceptable probably 12:54  the issue might be to convert HTML5 into XHTML 1.0 12:54  we might loose stuff 12:54  but there is one thing we are missing and we need to add for this use case: support for comments blocks, right now you will loose them because the rendering API does not have any idea what is a comment. the minimum would be to produce unknown block for comments in the html parser 12:55  unless we modify the WYSIWYG editor to use HTML5 instead of XHTML1.0 12:55  but not sure how that would work out 12:55  the WYSIWYG is not really XHTML 12:55  it's some HTML we then cleanup 12:55  it converts to XHTML 1.0 12:56  it convert to something the xhtml parser will support 12:56  not exactly the same as producing valid xhtml 1.0 :) 12:56  parse input syntax —> XHTML 1.0 —> make modifis —> parse as XHTML 1.0 input -> render as input syntax 12:57  s/XHTML 1.0 —>/render as XHTML 1.0 --> 12:57  what is more important IMO is what CKEditor does 12:58  yep, what it supports 12:58  right now we do the same 12:58  xhtml/1.0  as input to CK I believe 12:58  mflorea: ? 13:04  has quit 13:04  has joined #xwiki 13:10  vmassol: CKEditor doesn't fully handle HTML5. At the moment the output produced by the CKEditor is closer to the XHTML, so best is to input XHTML 13:10  https://dev.ckeditor.com/ticket/9457 13:20  has joined #xwiki 13:42  has quit 13:45  ok thanks mflorea 13:46  FTM I've just exluded xhtml/1.0 content from being editable with wysiwyg editor. I'm moving on to something else now 13:54  acotiuga: I'm merging your PR. I haven't tested it so I trust you to have done so :) 13:54  thanks 13:54  (I mean  in  various use cases) 13:55  wasn't there 2 issues related to this? 13:55  that we can close now? 13:56  acotiuga: hmm 13:57  we need to merge to the other branches 13:57  doing it 13:57  yes\ 13:57   I tested them both 13:59  did we have a test for it somewhere? 14:00  acotiuga: is https://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13301 fixed? 14:01  apparently yes, you don't have permissions to close issues? 14:02  done 14:02  (done  = closed as up) 14:03  has quit 14:07  has joined #xwiki 14:07  vmassol: XWIKI-13301 is fixed in XWIKI-13288, that's why I marked it as duplicate 14:08  yes but you forgot to close it 14:08  I've done it now 14:08  I don't have permissions 14:08  "apparently yes, you don't have permissions to close issues?" that was my question :) 14:12  you should have rights from now on 14:13  I've added you to the special contributors role in the xwiki-platform projects 14:13  I meant xwiki github org projects 14:30  has joined #xwiki 14:30  has quit 14:52  has quit 14:53  has joined #xwiki 15:47  has quit 16:03  has joined #xwiki 16:09  has quit 16:14  has joined #xwiki 16:15  has quit 16:39  has quit 16:40  has quit 16:46  has quit 17:09  has joined #xwiki 17:09  hi 17:10  i get high cpu usage when browsing the wiki 17:10  i looked at the performance page 17:11  ... is there  aliek a monitoring thing to diagnose where the issue can com , liek cache hit /miss ration , or time spent doing x/y 17:11  has quit 17:12  pascal\_: for the "time spent doing x/y" you have http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Performances#HPerformancetree 17:20  has joined #xwiki 17:20  has quit 17:39  has joined #xwiki 17:42  has quit
